summary: TickTask web app with working timers, updated branding/styling, and a new Reminders section.
known_issues: Timers do not currently work correctly when the user clicks on another timer within the same tab (timer may stop or behave incorrectly).

existing_features.title: Ensure each timer (Pomodoro, Stopwatch, Countdown, Interval, Repeating) continues running correctly when the user switches to a different timer tab and then switches back, without pausing, resetting, or losing elapsed/remaining time due to component unmounting/remounting.

Update the primary button styling so buttons use hex color #9E1C37 as the primary (default) button background color across the app (including light/dark themes), without editing files under the read-only `frontend/src/components/ui` path.

Add a new top-level "Reminders" tab/section to the main app navigation alongside the existing timer tabs, and implement a basic reminders UI that lets users create, view, edit, and delete reminders stored locally in the browser.

Add a small, timer-adjacent enhancement in response to "what else can you add?": provide an optional, user-toggleable end-of-timer alert that triggers when a timer completes (e.g., in-app dialog/toast and/or a short sound), implemented entirely client-side.

new_feature_requests.summary: Ensure timers continue running correctly when switching between timers within the tab (no pausing/resetting on selection changes).
Update button styling to use hex color #9E1C37.
Add a Reminders tab/section to the website.
